title: My issues with the new Eve, and how I'd like to see them fixed.
body:
tl;dr

Eve's early game is far too weak, and her late game isn't strong enough to compensate.
She's nearly unplayable in lanes, yet can't exert any level of jungle pressure pre-6, rendering her essentially useless.
Her target access is garbage. She's far too slow after Dark Frenzy was removed.


**Demon Shade**

Look, I get what you're trying to do by gating her stealth to post-6, but it's not the right way to go

Eve has a decent clear speed, a fragile clear, and low early damage. That's nothing new, but old Eve could at least use her marginal damage to surprise an enemy.

Now, Eve is weak to the point of absurdity until level 6. As a jungler, this is a death sentence. Did you learn nothing from the old Warwick?

Eve should be weak pre-6, but you guys didn't need to take her stealth away to do that; you already did it with the rest of her kit.

**Hate Spike**

Eve's Q, her primary source of damage, deals a grand total of 130/180/230/280/330 base damage with a whopping 195% AP ratio.

Doesn't sound so bad, eh? Well, look past the pretty number and into how you get it. All of it is insanely conditional.

You have to land the **entire** spell to get that number. Sounds reasonable, but it's quite problematic.

First, the most obvious case: if you miss the dart. Missing the dart means you only have the un-enhanced hate spikes, which will deal a total of 75/90/105/120/135 (+ 90% AP) damage. This is reasonable.

Second, less obvious: if you can't get the hate spikes off. The vast majority of the damage lies in the enhanced hate spikes. If this is the case, you will only deal 25/30/35/40/45 (+ 30% AP) damage.

For context, the initial damage from a single hit of Teemo's poison is 10/20/30/40/50 (+ 30% AP) magic damage.

This is a farily common occurence. The new Eve is extrordinarily squishy, and it's often pretty damn risky to stay in range long enough to use your hate spikes. The CD between spikes is half a second, and you have three of them. This means that Eve, being as squishy as she is, has to run at you for 1.5 seconds before she can get the full damage off, hoping she doesn't die in the process. Maybe if the barrage CD was reduced by rank, it would be more feasable, but it isn't. Instead, it's only reduced by CDR. Eve should be all about her burst, not spamming at 45% CDR.

 The other issue with this is her newfound lack of mobility. Even if she can survive their damage, anyone with an escape can get out of her Q range. Without Dark Frenzy to keep Eve in range, **HATE SPIKE DOESN'T WORK**. Going off of that, she can't keep up with anybody in a fight in general, since she's gimped into buying Mobis instead of boots that would actually help her keep up.

The spell has pitiful damage in the early-mid game. It only gets rolling once Eve gets lots of AP, at which point she's largely a mute point due to how unlikely it is for her to get the full spell off on a priority target.

**Allure**

I like the concept of this spell,  but it needed a little more brainstorming.

Ok. Eve marks her target and... now what? 

There are only three courses of action an Eve can take.

* Hope to tag the enemy with a max range Q.
* Ult backwards and attack at melee range.
* Flash for it.

If she does the first, she's just a worse version of Elise. In any case, the charm would wear off before Eve can get the rest of her damage off.

If she does the second, she now lacks both the necessary damage to finish the kill and her escape. 

If she does the third, you're down a flash on a squishy champion. Since your ult will get used in the fight most likely, this makes you hella vulnerable for a while.

Old Eve would have loved this spell, but it doesn't work here. The reason is simple: New Eve is fucking slow.

Riot, you seem to have underestimated how important Dark Frenzy was to Eve's kit.

That spell, despite how basic it may seem, was the reason why her old passive worked. She didn't meander out of stealth like she does now, she pounced.

Because of this major issue with her kit, Eve is all but forced into building Mobis and Protobelt to get to the target initially, even though she'd really rather be buying other items.

Protobelt is fine and dandy, but Mobis are where the problem is. Eve is roam heavy. Mobis should be a strong option on her, but being forced into buying them causes issues with every other active spell.

**Whiplash**

Whiplash is an amazing spell... once you get Lich Bane and Ludens. The issue is that you're forced to delay that powerspike with a Protobelt to even use the damn thing.

It suffers from the same issues as Allure: you are too slow to reach the target in the first place. This means you need mobis, 

Delaying the power spike would be somewhat okay... if the base damage on this thing hadn't been gutted.

Ravage did 230 (+1.0 AP) (+1.0 bonus AD) damage at max rank. Whiplash, when empowered, does 140 (+6% max HP) (+4% max HP per 100 AP). The flat damage was nearly halved, and the % HP damage doesn't do a whole lot against the targets Eve is gonna be gunning for. 

The movement speed on the spell helps keep up with her Q, but she really needed it a couple seconds earlier so she could land the damn thing in the first place.

**Last Caress**

First off, Widowmaker was a better name.

Other than that, this spell is incredible. There's almost nothing I don't like about it.

Almost.

Last Caress is an incredible spell that is broken by Eve requiring Mobis.

This spell is Eve's only way out aside from "kill everything". 

Thing is, Eve is really slow after using it since her Mobis are almost always deactivated by the spell, and her Demon Shade is put on full CD by the same thing.

This means that, unless you went over a wall, the backwards blink is just not enough to get you out. The enemy can see exactly where you are, and they are definitely faster than you.

-_-

**Proposal**

Of course, all these complaints without a suggestion is little more than long-winded whining. There's enough of that on this website, so here's something I think will work.

>  **Demon Shade**
~~Camouflage only at 6+~~ >> Lesser Camouflage from level 1, upgraded at level 6
"Lesser Camouflage": Increased detection range and enemies are notified if you pass over one of their wards. The area revealed by the ward starts glowing red if Eve is there.

This should give Eve the necessary tools to be a champion that exists pre-6, while not being quite the oppressive shitlord she used to be.

>  **Whiplash**
>  E no longer gives MS on hit
>  (New) Passive - Dark Frenzy: Effecting an enemy champion with a spell or basic attack grants 15% increased movement speed for 1.5 seconds. Allure procs this both on application and when the charm is primed. Last Caress grants double the speed boost, triple if a champion was killed.

Yay, target access!

>  **Last Caress**
> (New) Cleanses slows on activation.

So Eve's dramatic exit **stays** as an exit.

I replied to you in another thread, but I'd rather have two different changes (beyond the fact I personally loathe her new ult)

1) Make Allure re-activatable for her Charm. You don't even need to change the cook time, but if Eve is within 600-800 units of a marked target, she can re-cast it to Charm her victim.

She needs a more reliable way to proc it seeing how much counterplay it has for 1-2 seconds of CC. Bloody Lulu can incapicitate champions for longer with a mouse click.

2) Camo remains at level 6. Camoflague needs to stay consistent with any others in the game, none of this ward pinging stuff. It makes camoflague redundant in that case.

Instead, just make the detection radius shrink by 25 units per level from 6. Her camo reveal isn't actually THAT much longer than pre-rework, but at level 18, this would be 300 units shorter (guessing her camo is around 700-800 right now)

I also agree that her abilities are rather.....lackluster.

To me her Q doesn't do much dmg unless you hit the entire combo off, and I find it very difficult to aim at your main intended target. 

Her charm has all drawbacks previously listed, but my main concern is that it feels like it hardly does anything other than make you walk back for a brief moment. 

Her E I find to be very useless since it is basically an empowered autoattack, and has about the same range, I believe it would be more effective if it had a longer range and pulled you to the enemy you're hitting, that to me would be much more effective for her combo, and would even make her charm more reliable in and of itself. 

I'll admit her passive is interesting, but I agree that her pre-6 camo ability makes her almost useless until then, however I do like that it helps her sustain between fights and clearing. But I believe it would help if it gave you a little MS boost to help you close in for ganks/kills, and last for a few seconds after being sighted or combat is entered.

I personally do not like her ult at all, to me it feels like a Garen ult, but it usually leaves the other champions barely alive and now I'm even further away from them, and I had to waste my entire kit just to get close enough to......not kill them anyway. In total agreement there.

Less reliable target access and high damage spread out over time is a Skirmisher's MO.  Assassins should have very high target access with a shorter burst pattern.

But in their crusade to add outplay potential to everything that isn't auto-attacks, Riot has absolutely wrecked the balance between champ archetypes.

I'd like to see what would happen if Eve's camouflage were turned into full invisibility. She's balanced around heavily telegraphing her entrance with W anyway, and the vast majority of her damage is back-loaded, meaning it's very difficult for her to chunk someone too hard directly from stealth. Camouflage as a mechanic I feel is critically flawed, as it either does very little to actually give counterplay to a champion (i.e. Twitch) or invalidates their stealth to a large extent (e.g. Eve, with Rengar being a mix of both). Either way, the core gameplay of the reveal radius goes directly against the main purpose of stealth, which is to let champions land the first strike and do so undetected, and I feel designing champions' burst patterns around Camouflage has led to some pretty confused design in the past. Eve's new back-loaded damage pattern is good enough that I feel she doesn't need to be detected at close ranges, but Rengar and Twitch are still very much in one-shot-from-stealth territory whenever they get fed.
Maybe it could upgrade to full invis at lvl 11, kind of how it upgrades to camo at 6 now

That could indeed be a viable option, imo, particularly since Eve already falls off a cliff in the late game due to how easily she gets shut down while trying to assassinate priority targets. If possible, though, I'd like to see how she'd operate with full invisibility from level 1 onwards: I feel there's this huge fear that Eve's ganks would be oppressive if she had her stealth sooner, but at this point she's probably one of the fairest gankers out there, even with Camouflage, as everything she does is telegraphed over a very long duration. Moreover, she has plenty of balancing levers in case she does happen to be too bursty (she could be made more dependent on her charm, for example, or the delay on her Q recasts could be increased at early ranks), which is why I think that even if she did happen to be too good with full invisibility at level 1, or just Camouflage, she could still be tuned around it in a way that would still make her satisfying to play.

Some problems with your problems. 

Evelynn is meant to have a pretty severe weakness - a lack of outright mobility. She is the only permanently stealthed champion in the game. She can either hunt down and sneak up on targets for kills, or she can dash up on them. One or the other, not both. She'd be insanely busted if she still had access to incredible speed bursts with her current kit, as that would eliminate her weaknesses. If you're upset with losing Dark Frenzy, run her with Ghost. 

It also sounds like you're playing Eve completely wrong. Eve is not a balls deep, in your face champ. She doesn't come from the front and just blast someone away. She comes up from unexpected angles and freaks people out, using the chaos of suddenly finding her on top of you to land a kill. Her entire kit revolves around this playstyle. If you don't like it, play someone else. Play Rengar if you want the in-your-face assassin who hunts people down. But don't play Eve if that's what you're looking for, because that isn't how she plays.
